    • Constructor Detail

      • AdvancedComm

        public AdvancedComm(AdvancedCommReceiver commReceiver,
            java.lang.String[] events1,
            java.lang.String[] events2)
        Gives an instance of AdvancedComm that can send and receive information. Extend AdvancedCommReceiver and define receive() which is called by AdvancedComm every time it receives information from the other device.
        Parameters:
        commReceiver - a new instance of any subclass of AdvancedCommReceiver
        events1 - user-chosen strings that identify each type of message sent/received
        events2 -

      • AdvancedComm

        public AdvancedComm(CommChannel channel,
            AdvancedCommReceiver commReceiver,
            java.lang.String[] events1,
            java.lang.String[] events2)
        Gives an instance of AdvancedComm that can send and receive information. Extend AdvancedCommReceiver and define receive() which is called by AdvancedComm every time it receives information from the other device. The communications "channel" can be changed, ie. the sockets use a tcp port other than the default port 8888 (A), ranging to port 8880 (H).
        Parameters:
        channel - user-chosen "channel" for the communications (different tcp port than default A)
        commReceiver - a new instance of any subclass of AdvancedCommReceiver
        events1 - user-chosen strings that identify each type of message sent/received
        events2 -

      • AdvancedComm

        public AdvancedComm(java.lang.String[] events1,
            java.lang.String[] events2)
        Gives an instance of AdvancedComm that can only connect and send information to the other device.
        Parameters:
        events1 - user-chosen strings that identify each type of message sent/received
        events2 -

      • AdvancedComm

        public AdvancedComm(CommChannel channel,
            java.lang.String[] events1,
            java.lang.String[] events2)
        Gives an instance of AdvancedComm that can only connect and send information to the other device. The communications "channel" can be changed, ie. the sockets use a tcp port other than the default port 8888 (A), ranging to port 8880 (H).
        Parameters:
        channel - user-chosen "channel" for the communications (different tcp port than default A)
        events1 - user-chosen strings that identify each type of message sent/received
        events2 -

    • Method Detail

      • getEvents

        public CommEvent getEvents()
        Gets the local object that describes communication events.
        Returns:
        commEvents object

      • getReceiver

        public AdvancedCommReceiver getReceiver()
        Gets back the internal instance of the AdvancedCommReceiver, to be able to read back values if convenient.
        Returns:
        the original AdvancedCommReceiver, but connected and initialized

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Tells if the program has connected to a device yet.
        Returns:
        if connected to something

      • send

        public boolean send(java.lang.String event1,
           java.lang.String event2,
           lejos.robotics.Transmittable data)
        Basic method to send an event and an object that can be serialized into basic data types and back again.
        Parameters:
        event - predefined event that is shared knowledge between both PcComm and EV3Comm
        data - an object which can be turned into basic data types, sent through dos and turned back into an object. Can be null to send nothing.
        Returns:
        true for successful data sending

      • waitForConnection

        public void waitForConnection()
        Waiting for another device to connect to this one and send it commands.

      • connect

        public boolean connect(java.lang.String ipAddress)
        Connect to an ev3 brick with an ip address.
        Parameters:
        ipAddress - the ip address of the brick

      • establishConn

        public void establishConn(lejos.remote.nxt.NXTConnection conn)
        Initializes the data streams and starts the receiver daemon.
        Parameters:
        conn - a connection to a brick
